document.docAuthor: Gonçalves, Rodrigo B. & Santos, Leandro M.
document.masterDocTitle: Notes and new species of the halictine genus Megommation Moure (Hymenoptera, Apidae, Augochlorini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes and new species of the halictine genus Megommation Moure (Hymenoptera, Apidae, Augochlorini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Halictus insignis
Smith, 1853
. Holotype male ( OUM ) from South America (not examined).

Halictus cherazon
Vachal, 1904
. Holotype female ( MNHP ), from Brazil , Espírito Santo (not examined).

Megalopta virgili
Friese, 1911
. Syntype male ( ZMB ), from Brazil , Santa Catarina, Blumenau (not examined).

Megalopta (Megaloptella) ipomoeae
Schrottky, 1912
.
Lectotype male and paralectotype female ( MZSP ) from Brazil , Minas Gerais, Mar de Espanha , hereby designated (examined).

Megalopta pallitarsis
Friese, 1926
. Syntype male ( ZMB ) from Brazil : Espírito Santo and Piauí (not examined).

Diagnosis.
M. insigne
can be recognized by its dark body coloration and abundant body pubescence (
Figs. 4– 7
), epistomal suture obtuse and patch of black setae occupying entire outer surface of metatibia. Additional features are listed in the identification key.

Comments. The lectotype male and paralectotype female of
Megalopta (Megaloptella) ipomoeae
Schrottky, 1912
, both collected in Mar de Espanha (state of Minas Gerais) in
VI. 1908
by Zikán are hereby designated in order to stabilize the taxonomy of the group. The remaining types from other original localities ( Argentina and Paraguay ) were not located and are probably lost (see
Rasmussen et al . 2009
). Examination of type material for other available names is required in order to confirm the current synonymies. In additional to the literature records, we summarized specimen label information of material deposited in DZUP and MZSP (
Figure 7
).

FIGURES 4–6.
Megommation insigne
, types of
Megalopta
(Megaloptella) ipomoeae
Schrottky, 1912
. (4) Paralectotype female, lateral habitus; (5) paralectotype female, frontal view of the head; (6) lectotype male, frontal view of the head. Figures 5 and 6 to same scale.

FIGURE 7. Map of distributions of
Megommation insigne
(squares) and
M. amazonicum
n. sp.
(circle).
